example.eg: The star was famous for playing tricks on his fellow actors.
example.egtrans: 这位影星以喜欢捉弄他的搭档而出名。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 把戏, 胡闹, 胡闹

example.eg: I didn't want to buy the ticket -- I was tricked!
example.egtrans: 我本不想买票的，可是被骗了！

example.eg: Julia was tricked into marriage by a man who said he loved her when he was only after her money.
example.egtrans: 那人说他爱茱莉亚，骗她结了婚，但他看重的只是茱莉亚的钱。

example.eg: The scammer tricked Brian into handing over £400.
example.egtrans: 诈骗者从布莱恩手中骗走了400英镑。

example.eg: The con man tricked the old lady out of her savings by pretending to work for a charity.
example.egtrans: 犯罪分子假装成慈善机构员工，骗走了老妇人所有的积蓄。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 欺诈, 欺骗, 哄骗

example.eg: Is this a trick question?
example.egtrans: 这是个捉弄人的问题吗？

example.eg: The kids were delighted by the magician's tricks.
example.egtrans: 魔术师的魔术戏法逗乐了孩子们。

example.eg: All this for only fifty pounds?! What's the trick?
example.egtrans: 所有这些只要50英镑？！这是什么骗局吗？

trans_examp.trans_cn: 诡计, 骗术, 骗局

example.eg: I can't seem to get the trick of how to cut a tomato.
example.egtrans: 我似乎掌握不了切番茄的窍门。

example.eg: In the game of hearts, you usually want to win as few tricks as possible.
example.egtrans: 在红心大战中，你通常想要获得尽可能少的分数。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 一墩牌，一圈牌, 分数

example.eg: The prostitute collected her money and sent the trick on his way.
example.egtrans: 妓女收好了钱，送走了嫖客。

example.eg: The juggler is trying to learn a new trick.
example.egtrans: 杂耍人正在试图学习一种新的把戏。

dsense.name: trick [sth] out, trick out [sth]
dsense.guideword: US, informal (dress up, deck out) (非正式用语)

example.eg: The street racer tricked out his car with a new paint job and florescent lighting.
He knows a lot of card tricks.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 玩纸牌的窍门, 千术

example.eg: Fred lost two hundred dollars in a con.
example.egtrans: 弗莱德上了骗局的当，损失了两百美金。

example.eg: He's a con artist, so watch out for his dirty tricks.
example.egtrans: 他是一位犯罪高手，要小心他的伎俩。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 卑鄙的行为, 伎俩, 阴谋

dsense.name: hat trick, hat-trick
dsense.guideword: figurative (sport: scoring three goals) (体育比赛)

example.eg: I just need one more to get a hat trick.

dsense.name: hat trick, hat-trick
dsense.guideword: (magic: pulling [sth] from a hat) (从帽子里变出东西来的魔术)

example.eg: The magician's hat trick drew wild applause from the audience.
The magic trick made the white rabbit seem to disappear.

dsense.name: trick or treat, trick-or-treat
dsense.guideword: (Halloween tradition) (万圣节儿童讨要糖果的用语)

example.eg: Trick or treat's the only thing I like about Hallowe'en.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不给糖果就捣蛋, 陷阱问题

dsense.name: trick-or-treating
dsense.guideword: (Halloween custom: going door to door) (万圣节孩子们上门玩的游戏)

example.eg: Last year, I took my brother trick-or-treating.
